metadata.title: CVE-2017-7671 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
There is a DOS attack vulnerability in Apache Traffic Server (ATS) 5.2.0 to5.3.2, 6.0.0 to 6.2.0, and 7.0.0 with the TLS handshake. This issue cancause the server to coredump.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 7.1.2+ds-2build1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 7.1.2+ds-2build1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.1.2+ds-2build1').
